channel.title: Science : NPR
channel.description: The latest health and science news. Updates on medicine, healthy living, nutrition, drugs, diet, and advances in science and technology. Subscribe to the Health & Science podcast.

item.title: John McCain Was Diagnosed With A Glioblastoma, Among The Deadliest Of Cancers
item.description: July 20, 2017 - About 12,000 people are diagnosed with a glioblastoma each year in the U.S. Fewer than a third of them will survive beyond two years.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 20, 2017 - About 12,000 people are diagnosed with a glioblastoma each year in the U.S. Fewer than a third of them will survive beyond two years. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/20/538295015/john-mccain-was-diagnosed-with-a-glioblastoma-among-the-deadliest-of-cancers

item.title: Elephant Seals Can Recognize Rhythm And Pitch
item.description: July 20, 2017 - A new study reveals that elephant seals memorize the rhythm and pitch of individual voices. That means that the massive sea mammals know who's who, just by the sound of their voice.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 20, 2017 - A new study reveals that elephant seals memorize the rhythm and pitch of individual voices. That means that the massive sea mammals know who's who, just by the sound of their voice. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/07/20/538092965/elephant-seals-can-recognize-rhythm-and-pitch

item.title: Opioid Treatment Funds In Senate Bill Would Fall Far Short Of Needs
item.description: July 20, 2017 - A Senate proposal to repeal Obamacare includes $45 billion to treat opioid addiction. But it wouldn't make up for deep cuts to Medicaid in that same bill that has funded much of that treatment.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 20, 2017 - A Senate proposal to repeal Obamacare includes $45 billion to treat opioid addiction. But it wouldn't make up for deep cuts to Medicaid in that same bill that has funded much of that treatment. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/20/537661375/opioid-treatment-funds-in-senate-bill-would-fall-far-short-of-needs

item.title: Climate Scientist Says He Was Demoted For Speaking Out On Climate Change
item.description: July 19, 2017 - Joel Clement, who was director of the Interior Department's Office of Policy Analysis during the Obama administration, says in a newspaper op-ed that he was reassigned to an "accounting office."
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 19, 2017 - Joel Clement, who was director of the Interior Department's Office of Policy Analysis during the Obama administration, says in a newspaper op-ed that he was reassigned to an "accounting office." http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/07/19/538216232/climate-scientist-says-he-was-demoted-for-speaking-out-on-climate-change

item.title: Plastic Is Everywhere And Recycling Isn't The End Of It
item.description: July 19, 2017 - A researcher tallied how much has been manufactured since plastic's invention: "Eight point three billion metric tons of plastics produced so far. That's just really a staggering amount."
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 19, 2017 - A researcher tallied how much has been manufactured since plastic's invention: "Eight point three billion metric tons of plastics produced so far. That's just really a staggering amount." http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/07/19/538166682/plastic-is-everywhere-and-recycling-isnt-the-end-of-it

item.title: Getting Really Smart About Artificial Intelligence
item.description:
July 19, 2017 - AI isn't on the way … it's already here.
- http://the1a.org/shows/2017-07-19/getting-real-smart-about-artificial-intelligence
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: Viewing The Great American Eclipse
item.description: July 19, 2017 - There's something deeply moving about watching the sun become progressively covered by the moon — and you have a rare chance to see this in the U.S. on Aug. 21, says astrophysicist Marcelo Gleiser.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 19, 2017 - There's something deeply moving about watching the sun become progressively covered by the moon — and you have a rare chance to see this in the U.S. on Aug. 21, says astrophysicist Marcelo Gleiser. http://www.npr.org/sections/13.7/2017/07/19/538062450/viewing-the-great-american-eclipse

item.title: Researchers Examine When People Are More Susceptible To Fake News
item.description: July 18, 2017 - Whether people consume news in a social setting or alone can affect how likely they are to fact-check. Research suggests people let their guard down when they're in groups and become less skeptical.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 18, 2017 - Whether people consume news in a social setting or alone can affect how likely they are to fact-check. Research suggests people let their guard down when they're in groups and become less skeptical. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/18/537844762/researchers-examine-when-people-are-more-susceptible-to-fake-news

item.title: Students Compete In First-Ever International High School Robotics Competition
item.description: July 17, 2017 - The first-ever international high school robotics competition is happening in Washington, D.C., this week. Over 150 countries from six continents sent teams to compete.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 17, 2017 - The first-ever international high school robotics competition is happening in Washington, D.C., this week. Over 150 countries from six continents sent teams to compete. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/17/537754562/students-compete-in-first-ever-international-high-school-robotics-competition

item.title: New Research Suggests Why Mid-Sized Animals Are The Fastest
item.description: July 17, 2017 - New research suggests the biggest animals run out of fuel for their fast-twitch muscles before they reach the maximum speed their bodies could achieve. Animals like cheetahs are born to run fast.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 17, 2017 - New research suggests the biggest animals run out of fuel for their fast-twitch muscles before they reach the maximum speed their bodies could achieve. Animals like cheetahs are born to run fast. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/07/17/537754520/new-research-suggests-why-mid-sized-animals-are-the-fastest

item.title: In Massachusetts, Proposed Medicaid Cuts Put Kids' Health Care At Risk
item.description: July 17, 2017 - Doctors, consumers and politicians say big federal cuts to Medicaid funding would jeopardize the treatment a lot of kids rely on. The state would either have to make up lost funding or cut benefits.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 17, 2017 - Doctors, consumers and politicians say big federal cuts to Medicaid funding would jeopardize the treatment a lot of kids rely on. The state would either have to make up lost funding or cut benefits. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/17/537695506/in-massachusetts-proposed-medicaid-cuts-put-kids-health-care-at-risk

item.title: More Than Bread: Sourdough As a Window Into The Microbiome
item.description: July 17, 2017 - Home bakers in the U.S., Europe and some other countries have volunteered their sourdough starters to a team of American scientists who want to unravel the microbial secrets of sourdough.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 17, 2017 - Home bakers in the U.S., Europe and some other countries have volunteered their sourdough starters to a team of American scientists who want to unravel the microbial secrets of sourdough. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/07/17/536485684/more-than-bread-sourdough-as-a-window-into-the-microbiome

item.title: Elon Musk Warns Governors: Artificial Intelligence Poses 'Existential Risk'
item.description: July 17, 2017 - At a bipartisan governors conference in Rhode Island, the CEO of Tesla urged politicians to impose proactive regulations on AI development.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 17, 2017 - At a bipartisan governors conference in Rhode Island, the CEO of Tesla urged politicians to impose proactive regulations on AI development. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/17/537686649/elon-musk-warns-governors-artificial-intelligence-poses-existential-risk

item.title: Stress And Poverty May Explain High Rates Of Dementia In African-Americans
item.description: July 16, 2017 - New research finds that African-Americans who grow up in harsh environments and have many stressful experiences are much more likely to develop Alzheimer's or some other form of dementia.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 16, 2017 - New research finds that African-Americans who grow up in harsh environments and have many stressful experiences are much more likely to develop Alzheimer's or some other form of dementia. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/16/536935957/stress-and-poverty-may-explain-high-rates-of-dementia-in-african-americans

item.title: Maryam Mirzakhani, Prize-Winning Mathematician, Dies At 40
item.description: July 15, 2017 - Maryam Mirzakhani was the first woman to win the prestigious Fields Medal. She worked at Stanford University, which confirmed her death Saturday.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 15, 2017 - Maryam Mirzakhani was the first woman to win the prestigious Fields Medal. She worked at Stanford University, which confirmed her death Saturday. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/07/15/537419982/maryam-mirzakhani-prize-winning-mathemetician-dies-at-40
